Posts.Content: bondiblonde wrote: In 2005 I was diagnosed with IDC of 16mm, had a lumpectomy with sentinel node biopsy followed by radiation, 18 months tamoxifen and 5 years of femara. I have lots of scar tissue on the lumpectomy site and so have had a further 2 surgical biopsies to rule out suspicious areas but were both benign. In the past month I now have stated to get pain, sometimes just a general ache but at other times a specific sore spot in that breast along with a dull ache in my arm and tingling through my elbow to my fingers. The sore spots are close to the lumpectomy scar. They are just tender areas and I cannot feel a specific lump. Could this be nerve pan after all these years? Has anyone else had this experience? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pain after 9 years? bondiblonde bondiblonde

Posts.Content: Oct 6, 2014 01:21AM bondiblonde wrote: Is a torn pectoral muscle. Apparently the radiation field skimmed my top rib bones and top of lung which has weakened this area. Specialist said what would be a muscle tinge in a non radiated person becomes a major sprain/strain in a radiated person.
Posts.Title: Pain after 9 years? bondiblonde bondiblonde

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2014 03:34AM bondiblonde wrote: I have got check up scheduled now for 3 weeks but I am so freaking out. Think I am going nuts as I cant pinpoint where the pain is coming from. Sometimes the lumpectomy scar area but then at other times it is no where near that. Somedays I think I can feel a hardness but then an hour or so later even that has disappeared. I wake up during the night and my whole breast is sore but in the morning it's OK. Fingers crossed........
Posts.Title: Pain after 9 years? bondiblonde bondiblonde

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2014 12:44AM bondiblonde wrote: Will repair with rest. After describing where the pain was the doc asked me to lay on my back with my left hand pressing into my hip bone. He then pressed the spot where it was the sorest and I nearly hit the roof with the pain! Said he sees it a lot.
